keyEvents.title: Hachi Confronts Hody Jones
keyEvents.description: Hatchan arrives at Fish-Man District to confront Hody Jones about his plans.
keyEvents.significance: The setting for the major confrontation that reveals the depth of the villains' conspiracy.

keyEvents.title: Vander Decken Attacks Hachi
keyEvents.description: Vander Decken IX demonstrates his Mato Mato powers by marking and attacking Hachi with projectiles.
keyEvents.significance: Scene of the brutal attack that leaves Hachi critically wounded.

description: A slum district within Fish-Man Island where marginalized fish-men and merfolk live. It serves as the base of operations for Hody Jones and the New Fish-Man Pirates.

statusHistory.description: Shown as the gathering place for the New Fish-Man Pirates

reveals.information: Fish-Man District serves as the headquarters and gathering place for Hody Jones's conspiracy

keyEvents.title: Human Pirates Attack Palace Officials
keyEvents.description: Human pirates attack Brook and the Minister of the Right inside the palace.
keyEvents.significance: Shows that the palace has been infiltrated as part of Hody's plan.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Defend Palace
keyEvents.description: Zoro, Nami, and Usopp defend against attacking goons.

keyEvents.title: Palace Gates Breached
keyEvents.description: The palace gates are opened, allowing Hody Jones and his forces to enter.

description: The royal palace of the Ryugu Kingdom on Fish-Man Island, home to King Neptune and his family.

statusHistory.description: Palace hosting the Straw Hat Pirates as guests
Palace infiltrated and attacked by human pirates and New Fish-Man Pirates

reveals.information: The palace's security has been compromised by infiltrators

keyEvents.title: Shirahoshi Leaves Tower
keyEvents.description: Luffy escorts Shirahoshi out of Hard-Shell Tower for the first time in ten years.
keyEvents.significance: Shirahoshi's liberation from her decade-long imprisonment.

keyEvents.title: Brook Discovers Empty Tower
keyEvents.description: Brook and the Minister of the Right discover that Shirahoshi is gone from the tower.
keyEvents.significance: The discovery of Shirahoshi's absence triggers panic about her safety.

description: A heavily fortified tower within Ryugu Palace where Princess Shirahoshi was imprisoned for ten years to protect her from Vander Decken IX's stalking and attacks.

reveals.information: The tower served as both protection and prison for Shirahoshi for ten years

keyEvents.title: Franky Discovers Den
keyEvents.description: Franky discovers Tom's brother Den working in the graveyard of sunken ships.
keyEvents.significance: Connects Franky's backstory to the Sea Forest location.

keyEvents.title: Jinbe at Otohime's Grave
keyEvents.description: Jinbe is revealed sitting at Queen Otohime's grave, reflecting on her legacy.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the emotional and historical significance of the Sea Forest.

keyEvents.title: Luffy and Shirahoshi Arrive
keyEvents.description: Luffy and Shirahoshi arrive at the Sea Forest, finally allowing Shirahoshi to visit her mother's grave.
keyEvents.significance: The emotional climax of Shirahoshi's journey.

description: A sunken forest on Fish-Man Island that serves as a graveyard for ships and Fish-Man Island's most important figures. Contains Queen Otohime's grave and many historical artifacts.

reveals.information: The Sea Forest is where Queen Otohime is buried and where Shirahoshi has wanted to visit for ten years
Den (Tom's brother) works in the Sea Forest among the sunken ships

keyEvents.title: Jinbe Pays Respects
keyEvents.description: Jinbe is shown sitting at Queen Otohime's grave, reflecting on her ideals and legacy.
keyEvents.significance: Introduces the grave as a significant location and shows Jinbe's respect for Otohime.

keyEvents.title: Shirahoshi's First Visit
keyEvents.description: Shirahoshi arrives at her mother's grave for the first time in ten years.
keyEvents.significance: The culmination of Shirahoshi's decade-long wish to visit her mother's resting place.

keyEvents.title: Jinbe Explains History
keyEvents.description: Jinbe explains to Luffy the circumstances of Otohime's death and Shirahoshi's imprisonment.
keyEvents.significance: Provides crucial backstory about Fish-Man Island's tragic history.

description: The grave of Queen Otohime, located in the Sea Forest. It is the place Shirahoshi most wanted to visit for ten years but could not reach due to her imprisonment.

reveals.information: This grave represents Shirahoshi's unfulfilled desire to mourn her mother and the tragic circumstances that prevented her from attending the funeral
